info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 30 at 8:06AM CDT until May 4 at 3:11PM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Springfield MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri...
Marmaton River near Nevada affecting Vernon County.
For the Marmaton River...including Nevada...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Marmaton River near Nevada.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to Sunday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, the county road west of the gage, Minnie Ball Road, is impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 15.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 24.4 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.4 feet on 04/23/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 815 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO SUNDAY AFTERNOON
